cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (forecast to become Tropical Storm)
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn N-NE, cross the Florida Big Bend on Thursday, then sweep northeastward across north-central Florida and move offshore of the Georgia/South Carolina coast Friday before accelerating out into the open western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Anclote River to Indian Pass; Tropical-Storm Watch Indian Pass westward to Walton/Bay County line (all on Florida Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast (Aripeka to Indian Pass) first, then across the peninsula and along the coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts in squalls possible Thursday night–Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side near PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 3–5 inches with locally higher totals, creating street and terminal flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer bands cannot be ruled out, and elevated seas/short-period swell could disrupt pilot transfers and container-handling operations.
